newsitem.title: TAIWAN: Taiwan central bank injects T$16 bln in funds.
newsitem.headline: Taiwan central bank injects T$16 bln in funds.

text.p: Taiwan's central bank on Monday injected T$16 billion in funds into the banking system through open market operations, a bank official said.

The bank, operating through finance companies authorised to issue commercial paper, bought T$16 billion in approved securities instruments offered by financial institutions with yield at between 7.00 and 7.25 percent, the official said.
The institutions have the option of repurchasing the instruments within four to eight days, the official said.
Liquidity in the banking system has tightened drastically in recent days due to hectic demand for funds from a soaring stock market.
The overnight interbank rate has been at its highest levels in nearly a year and stood at 8.593 percent late on Monday.
